item.title: France, Germany Propose €500 Billion EU Pandemic Recovery Fund
item.description: France and Germany on Monday proposed establishing a €500 billion Europe-wide recovery fund to support European regions worst hit by the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: China Pitches for Global Leadership Role in Coronavirus Fight
item.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping used a WHO summit to assert a claim to global leadership in confronting the pandemic that started in his country, promising $2 billion in coronavirus aid—and backing the U.N. in its fight with the U.S.

item.title: Ukraine's Zelensky Finds Battling Corruption Is Harder Than It Was on TV
item.description: The comedian rose to power pledging to end conflict with Russia and root out graft.

item.title: Israeli Court Convicts Jewish Extremist of Palestinian Murder
item.description: Man convicted in a 2015 arson attack that killed a Palestinian couple and their baby in the Israel-occupied West Bank, spurring months of violence.

item.title: Hong Kong's Pro-Beijing Lawmakers Regain Upper Hand
item.description: Pro-Beijing lawmakers on Monday regained control of a committee crucial to passing a proposed law that would criminalize disrespect of China’s national anthem.

item.title:
Japan's Economy Fell Into
Recession in First Quarter of 2020
item.description: The third-largest economy slipped into a recession by one common definition in the first quarter of 2020, with worse expected in the current quarter.
